claim: Exactly 1,237 patients with a normal level of IGG were admitted to the hospital.
extra_info: normal level of IGG refers to 900 < IGG < 2000; admitted to the hospital refers to Admission = '+';
reasoning: The claim states exactly 1,237 patients with normal IGG (900 < IGG < 2000) were admitted (Admission = '+'). The query counting distinct patients matching both criteria returns 91, not 1,237. In fact, there are only 488 total admitted patients, making the claimed number impossible.

content.text: I'll verify this claim step by step. Let me start by exploring the database schema.

input.description: List all tables in the database

content.content:
CREATE TABLE Examination
(
    ID                 INTEGER          null,
    `Examination Date` DATE         null,
    `aCL IgG`          REAL        null,
    `aCL IgM`          REAL        null,
    ANA                INTEGER          null,
    `ANA Pattern`      TEXT null,
    `aCL IgA`          INTEGER          null,
    Diagnosis          TEXT null,
    KCT                TEXT null,
    RVVT              TEXT null,
    LAC                TEXT null,
    Symptoms           TEXT null,
    Thrombosis         INTEGER          null,
    foreign key (ID) references Patient (ID)
            on update cascade on delete cascade
);
CREATE TABLE Patient
(
    ID           INTEGER default 0 not null
        primary key,
    SEX          TEXT  null,
    Birthday     DATE          null,
    Description  DATE          null,
    `First Date` DATE          null,
    Admission    TEXT  null,
    Diagnosis    TEXT  null
);
CREATE TABLE Laboratory
(
    ID        INTEGER  default 0            not null,
    Date      DATE default '0000-00-00' not null,
    GOT       INTEGER                       null,
    GPT       INTEGER                        null,
    LDH       INTEGER                        null,
    ALP       INTEGER                        null,
    TP        REAL             null,
    ALB       REAL             null,
    UA        REAL             null,
    UN        INTEGER                       null,
    CRE       REAL             null,
    `T-BIL`   REAL             null,
    `T-CHO`   INTEGER                       null,
    TG        INTEGER                       null,
    CPK       INTEGER                       null,
    GLU       INTEGER                       null,
    WBC       REAL             null,
    RBC       REAL             null,
    HGB       REAL             null,
    HCT       REAL             null,
    PLT       INTEGER                       null,
    PT        REAL             null,
    APTT      INTEGER                       null,
    FG        REAL             null,
    PIC       INTEGER                       null,
    TAT       INTEGER                       null,
    TAT2      INTEGER                       null,
    `U-PRO`   TEXT              null,
    IGG       INTEGER                       null,
    IGA       INTEGER                       null,
    IGM       INTEGER                       null,
    CRP       TEXT              null,
    RA        TEXT              null,
    RF        TEXT              null,
    C3        INTEGER                       null,
    C4        INTEGER                       null,
    RNP       TEXT              null,
    SM        TEXT              null,
    SC170     TEXT              null,
    SSA       TEXT              null,
    SSB       TEXT              null,
    CENTROMEA TEXT              null,
    DNA       TEXT              null,
    `DNA-II`  INTEGER                       null,
    primary key (ID, Date),
        foreign key (ID) references Patient (ID)
            on update cascade on delete cascade
);

content.text: The database has the relevant columns: `IGG` in the `Laboratory` table and `Admission` in the `Patient` table. Now let me query for the count of patients matching the criteria.

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/thrombosis_prediction.sqlite" "SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT P.ID) FROM Patient P INNER JOIN Laboratory L ON P.ID = L.ID WHERE L.IGG > 900 AND L.IGG < 2000 AND P.Admission = '+';"
input.description: Count patients with normal IGG (900-2000) who were admitted

content.text: The query returns **91** patients, not 1,237 as the claim states. Let me double-check by also looking at the data more broadly to make sure I'm interpreting things correctly.

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/thrombosis_prediction.sqlite" "SELECT COUNT(*) FROM Patient WHERE Admission = '+';"
sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/thrombosis_prediction.sqlite" "SELECT COUNT(*) FROM Laboratory WHERE IGG > 900 AND IGG < 2000;"
input.description: Count lab records with normal IGG

content.text:
There are only 488 total admitted patients, which makes it impossible for 1,237 of them to have normal IGG levels. The actual count of distinct patients with normal IGG who were admitted is **91**, which clearly contradicts the claim of 1,237.

```json
{"label": "CONTRADICTED", "reasoning": "The claim states exactly 1,237 patients with normal IGG (900 < IGG < 2000) were admitted (Admission = '+'). The query counting distinct patients matching both criteria returns 91, not 1,237. In fact, there are only 488 total admitted patients, making the claimed number impossible."}
```
